answers.answer: Hi,How are you feeling?Is it that you tend to sleep over your arm?Tingling and numbness are signs of nerve dysfunction. Nerve dysfunction could be due to nerve compression, nerve impingement, Diabetes or any chronic disease like chronic kidney disease.In your case I think it could be due to nerve compression which is causing tingling.If you feel the symptoms are annoying, then you can visit a neurologist and get imaging study of cervical spine to know pathology.Keep me informed if you have any queries.Bye.

question: I have recently felt shoulder tingling in my right shoulder every time I try to lay down for sleep.  There is no pain only a tingling sensation every time I lay down or close my eyes. I have full range of motion and no loss of strength in this arm. Could you please tell me what this might be.  It is very fustrating and causing lack of sleep.
title: shulder tingle
